issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.customfield_12310192:
Issue: MSCK is failing in multithreaded execution

Solution:
  - Moved Path processor logic to an external class which will avoid code duplication and it will be used in both multi-threaded and single threaded execution.

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: MSCK REPAIR TABLE hanging while running with multi-threading enabled (default). I think it is because of a major design flaw in how thread pool implemented in HiveMetaSoreChecker class / checkPartitionDirs method. This method has a thread pool which register Callable but callable makes a recursive call to checkPartitionDirs method again. This code will hang when number of directories is more than thread pool size.
fields.summary: MSCK repair table hang while running with multi threading enabled

comments.body: When we implemented this, we tried to reuse the thread pool. Is it possible for you to provide us a reproduce case? Thanks.
[~pxiong] Reproducible is msck statement with # of dirs > # of threads.

[~pxiong] I moved the logic in inline callable to an external class so that code can be reused in with multi-threaded and non-multi threaded scenario. Also, it will fix the issues of thread lock. Could you please review. Tested with very large partitions (5K+) we have and worked fine.
that is fast... i was planning to do this today... Could u create a RB for it? Thanks.
Done. This first time I am using RB tool, please let me know if I need to provide more info. Thx
It would be helpful to have the repro for this. We have tried with 10K partitions and with 10 & 15 threads in MSCK which worked fine without issues.

Are you trying with partitions in hdfs? You may not run into issues if threads are fast enough to finish execution before recursive call happens, File systems like S3 will clearly shows error due to n/w latency.
This was tried with with partitions in S3. One of the main reason to make it multi-threaded is to improve the runtime for systems like S3 and azure.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12832969 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

[~rkamoor], there are several test cases failing, could u take a look at them? And, as [~rajesh.balamohan] suggested, we need to add a test case for the patch. If q tests are hard to add, maybe you can add a JUnit test with some artificial delay, e.g., thread.sleep, etc to expose the problem and prove the benefit of your patch. Thanks again for your efforts.
Deferring this to 3.1.0 since the branch for 3.0.0 has been cut off. Please update the JIRA if you would like to get your patch in 3.0.0.
